Package org.knime.core.webui.node.dialog.defaultdialog.widget.button

Interface ButtonActionHandler<R,S,M extends Enum<M>>

Type Parameters:
R - the type of the setting which is annotated by ButtonWidget
S - the type of the class representing all settings, this setting depends on (see DependencyHandler)
M - the state machine of the action handler. It is an enum where each field has to have a ButtonState annotation.
All Superinterfaces:
DependencyHandler<S>
All Known Implementing Classes:
CancelableActionHandler
public interface ButtonActionHandler<R,S,M extends Enum<M>> extends DependencyHandler<S>
The interface defining that a ButtonWidget.actionHandler() has to extend. It is used for initializing the button, updating it when dependent settings change and invoking actions on click.
Author:
Paul BÃ¤rnreuther

    castToDependencies

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      ButtonChange<R,M> initialize(R currentValue, DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext context) throws WidgetHandlerException
      This method is called whenever the dialog is opened in order to determine the initial state of the button.
      Parameters:
      currentValue - the current set value of the button field
      settings - the state of the dependency settings
      context - the current DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext
      Returns:
      the initial state of the button and its value.
      Throws:
      WidgetHandlerException - if the request should fail providing the error message to the frontend

    • invoke

      ButtonChange<R,M> invoke(M state, S settings, DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext context) throws WidgetHandlerException
      This method gets called when the button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      state - a string specified by the frontend in order to reuse the same invocation for multiple uses. E.g. this can be used to cancel an invocation (refer to CancelableActionHandler.
      settings - the settings of type S which the invocation depends on.
      context - the current DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext
      Returns:
      a representation of how the button is going to change or null if no change should happen due to this call.
      Throws:
      WidgetHandlerException - if the request should fail providing the error message to the frontend

    • castAndInvoke

      default ButtonChange<R,M> castAndInvoke(String stateString, Object settings, DefaultNodeSettings.DefaultNodeSettingsContext context) throws WidgetHandlerException
      Throws:
      WidgetHandlerException

      Throws:
      WidgetHandlerException

    • overrideButtonState

      default ButtonState overrideButtonState(M stateField, ButtonState buttonState)
      Override this method in order to adjust the states of the state machine. This might be useful if the same state machine should be used in different contexts (e.g. with different texts).
      Parameters:
      stateField - enum field from the associated state machine
      buttonState - the ButtonState annotation present at the enum field
      Returns:
      the ButtonState that should be used instead of the annotated one.

    • castToState

      default M castToState(String stateString)

    • getStateMachine

      Class<M> getStateMachine()
      The button has an associated state machine defined by the generic type. It is an enum where every enum field needs to have a ButtonState annotations We need the class of this generic type returned by this method in. order to
      1. serialize the state machine (i.e. the enum value and their ButtonState) with the initial data sent to the front-end
      2. map the string parameter sent by the front-end to their respective enum values
      We need this method to make the class of the state
      Returns:
      the class of the state machine.
